extras

Class BattleshipGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • extras.BattleshipGrid

  • public class BattleshipGrid
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Battleship game grid.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BattleshipGrid(int numRows, int numCols)
      Creates a new BattleshipGrid instance and randomly places ships on the grid.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Calculates the total number of hits required to destroy all ships and win the game.

      Returns the value of the cell at [row][col] if the cell is in bounds.

      Determine if the cell at the specified row and column is in the grid's bounds.
      private void initializeGrid()
      Initializes the game grid to size [NUM_ROWS][NUM_COLS] and sets each element of the grid to the constant EMPTY.
      private void placeAllShips()
      Places all of the game's ships onto the grid.
      void printGrid()
      Prints the grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleshipGrid

        public BattleshipGrid(int numRows,
                      int numCols)
        Creates a new BattleshipGrid instance and randomly places ships on the grid.
        Parameters:
        numRows - the number of rows in this grid
        numCols - the number of columns in this grid

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGrid

        private void initializeGrid()
        Initializes the game grid to size [NUM_ROWS][NUM_COLS] and sets each element of the grid to the constant EMPTY.

      • calculateTotalHitsRequired

        private static void calculateTotalHitsRequired()
        Calculates the total number of hits required to destroy all ships and win the game.

      • placeAllShips

        private void placeAllShips()
        Places all of the game's ships onto the grid.

      • attack

        public boolean attack(int row,
                      int col)
        Attacks the grid cell at the specified row and column. If the grid cell contains: - SHIP: the value of the cell is set to HIT - HIT: the value of the cell does not change Otherwise, the value of the cell is set to MISS. This method returns true if the attack resulted in a ship being hit, and false otherwise. Note: this method also returns true if a cell that has already been hit is attacked.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the cell to attack
        col - the column of the cell to attack
        Returns:
        true if the attack results in a ship being hit (even if the ship at that cell has already been hit), false otherwise

      • allDestroyed

        public boolean allDestroyed()
        Returns true if all of the ships have been destroyed, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if all ships have been destroyed, false otherwise

      • inBounds

        private boolean inBounds(int row,
                         int col)
        Determine if the cell at the specified row and column is in the grid's bounds.
        Parameters:
        row - the cell's row
        col - the cell's column
        Returns:
        true if the cell is in bounds, false otherwise

      • getCell

        public int getCell(int row,
                   int col)
        Returns the value of the cell at [row][col] if the cell is in bounds. Otherwise, returns OUT_OF_BOUNDS.
        Parameters:
        row - the cell's row
        col - the cell's column
        Returns:
        if in bounds, the value of the cell at [row][col], otherwise OUT_OF_BOUNDS

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid()
        Prints the grid.
